sanskrit_verse:
अतोऽन्यतमया वृत्त्या जीवंस्तु स्नातको द्विजः ।
स्वर्गायुष्ययशस्यानि व्रताणीमानि धारयेत् ॥ ४.१३॥
transliteration:
ato'nyatamayā vṛttyā jīvanstu snātako dvijaḥ |
svargāyuṣyayaśasyāni vratāṇīmāni dhārayet || 4.13||
sph_interpretive_translation: Therefore, a twice-born who has completed his studentship shall live by one of the prescribed livelihoods and continuously uphold these vows that lead to heavenly reward, longevity, fame, and righteousness.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from completion of foundational spiritual discipline
Causation is aligned with conscious choice of dharma-sustaining livelihood
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by stage of spiritual evolution
Restoration logic operates through sustained alignment with svarga-bound conduct
Consciousness alignment requires active maintenance of vowed disciplines
executable_legal_axioms: IF vow.boundary.crossed = TRUE THEN initiate_completion_process(duration: indefinite, until_consciousness_realignment)
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving spiritual class individuals post-initiation, the court must verify adherence to designated dharmic livelihood modes. Violations invoke not punitive measures but mandatory reintegration into vow-compliant living structures under qualified spiritual oversight.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes clear causal link between maintained vows and svargic outcomes. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential unfolding of karmic consequences as natural resultants, not imposed penalties. Responsibility is proportional to initiation-level capacity; justice functions as consciousness recalibration rather than external judgment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Vow Reaffirmation Process under Acharya supervision
Assign Svadhyaya and Shraddha Completion Rituals
Establish Daily Sankalpa Renewal Monitoring System
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Dharma flows from disciplined will, not coercive force; reality corrects through consciousness awakening, not punitive intervention; thus is Dharma restored.
